conditional_content.title: Conditional rendering of content
conditional_content.body:
In a React component, the conditional operator can be used as a convenient way to conditionally render content. For example, in the below snippet the LoginBanner is rendered to say that the user is or isn't logged in, depending on whether the isLoggedIn property is set to true or false. A conditional operator is used to test the property value and make the choice of rendering.

class LoginBanner extends Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
  }

  render() {
    return (
    <p>
      The user is <strong>{this.props.isLoggedIn ? 'currently' : 'not'}</strong> logged in.
    </p>
    );
  }
}

class App extends Component {
  render() {
    return (
    <LoginBanner isLoggedIn={false} />
    );
  }
}
